Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 81131: Commercial and Industrial Machinery and Equipment (except Automotive and Electronic) Repair and Main
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $50,001 to $100,000.

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Animal Health International Inc. (AHI), a Colorado corporation that obtains prescription drugs for animals from manufacturers for further distribution to veterinarians, farms, feedlots, and other facilities, pleaded guilty to charges of introducing a misbranded drug into interstate commerce. Also, Patterson Companies, Inc. AHI's corporate parent, entered into a non-prosecution agreement in which it committed to enhance its compliance program and fully comply with the law. The companies paid a $5 million federal fine, $1 million to the Virginia Department of Health Professionals, and a forfeiture money judgment of $46,802,203.
